questions.question_text:
Note: This question is part of a series of questions that present the same scenario. Each question in the series contains a unique solution. Determine whether the solution meets the stated goals. Some question sets might have more than one correct solution, while others might not have a correct solution.

After you answer a question in this section, you will NOT be able to return to it. As a result, these questions will not appear in the review screen.

A company is implementing Dynamics 365 Finance. The company has two legal entities in two different regions requiring separate tenants. CompanyA and CompanyB are both implementing Dynamics 365 Finance as separate implementation teams in a staggered approach.

CompanyA and CompanyB want to ensure that assets are accessible across the companies and to Microsoft but will not be publicly accessible to other companies.

You need to determine how to set up and configure assets to the Lifecycle Services (LCS) Asset library.

Solution: Upload assets with an organizational scope.

Does the solution meet the goal?

Note: This question is part of a series of questions that present the same scenario. Each question in the series contains a unique solution. Determine whether the solution meets the stated goals. Some question sets might have more than one correct solution, while others might not have a correct solution.

After you answer a question in this section, you will NOT be able to return to it. As a result, these questions will not appear in the review screen.

A company is implementing Dynamics 365 Finance. The company has two legal entities in two different regions requiring separate tenants. CompanyA and CompanyB are both implementing Dynamics 365 Finance as separate implementation teams in a staggered approach.

CompanyA and CompanyB want to ensure that assets are accessible across the companies and to Microsoft but will not be publicly accessible to other companies.

You need to determine how to set up and configure assets to the Lifecycle Services (LCS) Asset library.

Solution: Create a project-level library in LCS.

Does the solution meet the goal?

You are implementing Dynamics 365 Supply Chain Management. You have a CSV file that contains two million records.
You need to import the file into Dynamics 365 Supply Chain Management without manual manipulation of the data.
What should you use?

Note: This question is part of a series of questions that present the same scenario. Each question in the series contains a unique solution. Determine whether the solution meets the stated goals. Some question sets might have more than one correct solution, while others might not have a correct solution.

After you answer a question in this section, you will NOT be able to return to it. As a result, these questions will not appear in the review screen.

A company is implementing Dynamics 365 Finance. The company has two legal entities in two different regions requiring separate tenants. CompanyA and CompanyB are both implementing Dynamics 365 Finance as separate implementation teams in a staggered approach.

CompanyA and CompanyB want to ensure that assets are accessible across the companies and to Microsoft but will not be publicly accessible to other companies.

You need to determine how to set up and configure assets to the Lifecycle Services (LCS) Asset library.

Solution: Create a shared asset library in LCS.

Does the solution meet the goal?

A company uses Dynamics 365 Finance for accounts payable activities.

A user has returned from vacation. Upon returning, the company is in the next fiscal period. The previous fiscal period is still open for posting.

The user needs to backdate and post several entries within the previous fiscal period.

The records must look like they were posted in the previous fiscal period.

You need to recommend a solution.

What should you recommend?

choices.E: Post the entries through a batch job configured with a start date from the previous fiscal period.
choices.D: Change the system date and time of the userâ€™s local machine accessing the application.
choices.A: Post the entries and adjust the dates by using a SQL script.
choices.B: Change the dates on the journal entries to a date in the previous fiscal period.
choices.C: Change the date and time for the current user session.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
Cannot find any docs about configuration a batch job with backdate. 
https://community.dynamics.com/forums/thread/details/?threadid=5a8d7e50-5453-4b39-a7f4-c106ec959f86
